Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getMaximumLightness().Description: The maximum lightness value for this target.

Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getTargetLightness().Description: The target lightness value for this target.

isExclusive().Description: Returns whether any color selected for this target is exclusive for this target only. If false, then the color can be selected for other targets.

Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getMaximumSaturation().Description: The maximum saturation value for this target.

getLightnessWeight().Description: Returns the weight of importance that this target places on a color's lightness within the image. The larger the weight, relative to the other weights, the more important that a color being close to the target value has on selection.

Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getTargetSaturation().Description: The target saturation value for this target.

Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getMinimumLightness().Description: The minimum lightness value for this target.

getPopulationWeight().Description: Returns the weight of importance that this target places on a color's population within the image. The larger the weight, relative to the other weights, the more important that a color's population being close to the most populous has on selection.

Returns: no returns description in source Value is between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.
getMinimumSaturation().Description: The minimum saturation value for this target.

getSaturationWeight().Description: Returns the weight of importance that this target places on a color's saturation within the image. The larger the weight, relative to the other weights, the more important that a color being close to the target value has on selection.

ClassDesc: A class which allows custom selection of colors in a @B_android#support#v7#graphics#Palette_E@'s generation. Instances can be created via the @B_android#support#v7#graphics#Target#Builder_E@ class. To use the target, use the @B_android#support#v7#graphics#Palette#Builder#addTarget_E@ API when building a Palette.
